parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To plaster, wash over; I wipe off, wipe out, obliterate. From ek and aleipho; to smear out, i.e. Obliterate.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A tear. Or dakruon dak'-roo-on; of uncertain affinity; a tear.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The eye; fig: the mind's eye. From optanomai; the eye; by implication, vision; figuratively, envy.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
(a) of time: still, yet, even now, (b) of degree: even, further, more, in addition. Perhaps akin to etos; 'yet, ' still.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.
And not, neither, nor. From ou and te; not too, i.e. Neither or nor; by analogy, not even.
Mourning, sorrow, sadness, grief. Strengthened from the alternate of pascho; grief.
And not, neither, nor. From ou and te; not too, i.e. Neither or nor; by analogy, not even.
(a) a shout, cry, clamor, (b) outcry, clamoring against another. From krazo; an outcry.
And not, neither, nor. From ou and te; not too, i.e. Neither or nor; by analogy, not even.
(a) labor, toil, (b) pain, anguish, distress, suffering. From the base of penes; toil, i.e. anguish.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
First, before, principal, most important. Contracted superlative of pro; foremost.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and erchomai; to go off, aside or behind, literally or figuratively.
